TopicTitle: No science or report received after recovery

Articles.Content:
Hello.

I seem to have stumbled on a bug in Career mode. When I complete a mission and recover a vessel I don't seem to be receiving the science or reports. I first noticed this on my first vessel travelling to the Mun and back. I didn't receive the science from the Science Jr or the Mysterious Goo which I observed when landed. I also did not receive any new reports in the Science Archives.

I repeated the above and got the same result.

After this I tried a more local science experiment. Starting with 41.6 Science and 1.4 Science in 'Materials Study while flying at Kerbin', I sent a Science Jr into the sky above the space centre and observed the materials bay flying of Kerbin. It gave me a Recover data score of +16.4 Science. I pressed keep data, landed the ship and recovered the vessel. When I look back in my Science Archives I still seem to have only 1.4 Science in 'Materials Study while flying at Kerbin' and 41.6 Science in total.

I then tried somewhere I hadn't been before and did a Materials observation at Kerbin's Ice Caps. I got the same results here saying I should get +7.5 Science and when I go to the Science Archives, I have nothing in this report and still 41.6 Science in total.

I do have screenshots if you need, but as they just show the above I haven't included them.

It looks to me like I can't save missions or gain science. Anyone else seen this problem?

KPS Info:

version 0.90.0.705 Beta

Source: Steam

System Info:

Operating System: Windows 8.1 Pro 64-bit (6.3, Build 9600)

Language: English (Regional Setting: English)

System Manufacturer: Microsoft Corporation

System Model: Surface Pro 2

BIOS: 2.04.0950

Processor: Intel® Core i5-4200U CPU @ 1.60GHz (4 CPUs), ~2.3GHz

Memory: 4096MB RAM

Available OS Memory: 4016MB RAM

Page File: 6774MB used, 1428MB available

Windows Dir: C:\windows

DirectX Version: DirectX 11

DX Setup Parameters: Not found

User DPI Setting: Using System DPI

System DPI Setting: 144 DPI (150 percent)

Someone else posted a similar finding (with materials and goo at the north pole). I can't recall if it was confirmed then and haven't yet checked it out myself, but certainly sounds like something is going on.

Cheers,

-Claw
I'm not sure whether this one is specific to a particular area. I have tried experiments on two areas on Kerbin and on the Mun, but it seems this career has stuck on progress.

The weird thing is that I've done goo/jr both flying at Kerbin and on Mun and was able to get science for both, so I'm surprised you aren't getting science for that. So it makes me wonder if something specific needs to happen in order to trigger this bug. And I haven't tried at the north pole yet, so I don't know if it's broken up there.

Do you have a picture of the kind of ship you used to collect the science? And can you replicate this issue again in your save?

Cheers,

~Claw

I'm starting to think it may be an issue with my save game, rather than a specific area. Maybe there was something I've done previously in the game that triggered the bug, but since I only noticed it when I didn't get a report when returning from the Mun I've no idea what triggered it. It seems I can't get any more science in this save. I get the issue repeatedly when bringing back science, but I don't think I could replicate the trigger in a new career.

Here are a couple of pictures of the full craft;

And the science/recover part;

Hmm. I see noting unusual in your craft design. If you suspect a problem in your save, go ahead and post it too and we can have a look. Maybe there is a way to rescue it, or get some insight as to what is happening.

I would also ask (if you can) that you try to start the save, do a science run and recover (where it fails), then exit the game. Go grab the output_log.txt from the KSP_Data folder and post it here too. Perhaps there will be a clue in there as well.

And I shoud have asked...are you using any mods?

Cheers,

-Claw

I did what you suggested, recreating the experiment and here is the output file;

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cycnn7kwz05y1mx/output_log.txt?dl=0

Also, here is the save game persistent file;

https://www.dropbox.com/s/vmjb0ybm4ec7nj4/persistent.sfs?dl=0

- - - Updated - - -

Also, I'm not using any mods. Just the Steam installed KSP.

I see your science is logged, but showing nearly zero for some of the events (even though it's right there). Is there anything unusual about your flights? (I see lots of things colliding and exploding in your log file.)
I seem to have quite a similar problem https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/655111/output_log.txt

There isn't anything unusual about the flights. I think in this case the explosions were because I was trying to complete the flight quickly and I ejected my solid fuel rockets before they had run out. I got the same results on flights with no explosions.

I have noticed today that the career mode has been updated significantly since I started this save game. I probably should have picked up on this sooner. This career was from quiet some time ago. I wonder whether version compatibility is to blame for my problems. The only thing that still confuses me is why it worked for quite some time in the new version before stopping.

I think the solution is for me to start a new career. Frustrating, but seems to be the answer.

I admit I'm just getting back into the game and a bit of a newb but I think I'm having same problem. Transmitting gets me what it says it does. Recovery, nothing. So for example I have a simple unmanned probe, I send it out with a mobile sci lab. Take data, land and recover. Nothing. No wonder I can't seem to get anywhere in this game! Probably just a little bug I'm assuming?
